Hello, world!
My name is Maria, and I'm one of these nerds from the neighbourhood.

After university graduation I got my first job as a customer support representative with a huge international hosting provider. My communication skills and English knowledge got powered up with a general world wide web technical understanding, as well as basic-to-middle level hosting management skills.

I loved my job but had a feeling that devops is not my future. After spending a few evenings in industry research, I have confidently chosen my way of a front-end developer.

I'm a visual kind of person. Creating awesome digital experiences, transparent UX and reviving static design by adding animations is something that I definitely want to do.

I quit my job and spent months in education. Theory is everything and nothing at the same time — since my first completed theory milestones I've been creating landing pages of different complexity, with different frameworks and tools.

Learning curve will never end — but now I feel that I'm good to go as a junior front-end developer. So, this is the position I'm looking for.
